colspan="1" {{cGuest}} |- |} ==Reception== ===Critical reception=== During its first season, ''Shark Tank'' saw a mostly positive reception. Josh Wolk of ''[[Entertainment Weekly]]'' wrote, "The moneymen ask informed questions and make shrewd decisions, a welcome relief from [[Donald Trump]]'s capricious calls on Burnett's ''[[Celebrity Apprentice]]''."{{cite web|url=http://www.metacritic.com/tv/shark-tank|title=Shark Tank|publisher=Metacritic|accessdate=August 12, 2015}} Heather Havrilesky from [[Salon (website)|Salon]] said that "ABC's ''Shark Tank'' is easily the best new reality TV show to air this summer."{{cite web|url=http://www.salon.com/2009/08/02/sharks_2/|title=Who wants to be a billionaire?|author=Heather Havrilesky|work=Salon|accessdate=August 12, 2015}} Tom Shales of ''[[The Washington Post]]'' wrote, "It sounds gimmicky and visually tedious, with most of the so-called action taking place in a conference room. It's all those things, but the moments of misery make it memorable." Shales noted that the series was premiering during an economic recession, and that many of the aspiring entrepreneurs had poured significant amounts of money into their businesses; he praised "how deftly the show personalizes the desperation and pain experienced by victims of a broken down economy."{{cite web | url=https://articles.washingtonpost.com/2009-08-08/opinions/36927095_1_contestants-new-reality-show-judges | title=Shark Tank: ABC Is Out For Blood | work=The Washington Post | date=August 8, 2009 | accessdate=March 21, 2013 | author=Shales, Tom | deadurl=yes | archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130921054637/http://articles.washingtonpost.com/2009-08-08/opinions/36927095_1_contestants-new-reality-show-judges | archivedate=September 21, 2013 | df=mdy-all }} And David Hinckley of the ''[[New York Daily News]]'' said, "Once you get past its somewhat misleading title, Mark Burnett's new Shark Tank is a well-paced hour that offers entertainment without humiliation."{{cite web|url=http://www.nydailynews.com/entertainment/tv-movies/mark-burnett-shark-tank-abc-entertains-humiliating-capitalists-fish-financing-article-1.397721|title=Capitalists fish for financing on Mark Burnett's 'Shark Tank'|work=Daily News|location=New York|accessdate=October 19, 2015}} ===Ratings=== During the first two seasons, the series barely peaked at 5 million viewers, with season 2 only having 9 episodes in its run. But by season 3, the show's viewership went past 5 million and started to crack the top 100 in the ratings. By 2012, the show averaged over 6 million viewers per episode. It is the most watched program on Friday nights in the 18- to 49-year-old demographic.{{Cite news|url=https://www.hollywoodreporter.com/live-feed/shark-tank-grimm-chuck-tv-ratings-283774|title=TV Ratings: 'Shark Tank' Boosts ABC, 'Grimm' Jumps Double Digits|work=The Hollywood Reporter|access-date=2018-11-12|language=en}} {{CN|date=April 2017}} As a result, ABC added three more episodes to the original season order of 22. In its sixth season, the series reached over 9 million per episode, becoming its most successful season to date. {{Television season ratings | hide_18_49_rating = y | link1 = List of Shark Tank episodes#Season 1 (2009–10) | timeslot1 = Friday 9:00 pm | episodes1 = 14 | start1 = August 9, 2009 | premiere1 = 4.23{{cn|date=April 2017}} | end1 = February 5, 2010 | finale1 = 4.65{{cn|date=April 2017}} | season1 = 2009–10 | rank1 = 102 | viewers1 = 4.81{{cite web|last=Gorman|first=Bill|title=Final 2009–10 Broadcast Primetime Show Average Viewership|url=http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2010/06/16/final-2009-10-broadcast-primetime-show-average-viewership/54336/|publisher=TV by the Numbers/[[Zap2it]]|date=June 16, 2010}} | link2 = List of Shark Tank episodes#Season 2 (2011) | timeslot2 = Friday 8:00 pm | timeslot_length2 = 2 | episodes2 = 9 | start2 = March 20, 2011 | premiere2 = 6.13{{cn|date=April 2017}} | end2 = May 13, 2011 | finale2 = 4.99{{cn|date=April 2017}} | season2 = 2010–11 | rank2 = 113 | viewers2 = 5.12{{cite web|last=Gorman|first=Bill|title=2010–11 Season Broadcast Primetime Show Viewership Averages|url=http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2011/06/01/2010-11-season-broadcast-primetime-show-viewership-averages/94407/|publisher=TV by the Numbers/Zap2it|date=June 1, 2011}} | link3 = List of Shark Tank episodes#Season 3 (2012) | episodes3 = 15 | start3 = January 20, 2012 | premiere3 = 6.25{{cite web|url=http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2012/01/23/friday-final-tv-ratings-kitchen-nightmares-supernatural-repeat-adjusted-up/117317/ |title=Friday Final TV Ratings: 'Kitchen Nightmares,' 'Supernatural' Repeat Adjusted Up |publisher=TV by the Numbers/Zap2it|accessdate=June 14, 2012}} | end3 = May 18, 2012 | finale3 = 5.52{{cite web|url=http://tvbythenumbers.zap2it.com/2012/05/21/friday-final-tv-ratings-shark-tank-supernatural-finales-adjusted-up-what-would-you-do-adjusted-down/135180/|title=Friday Final TV Ratings: 'Shark Tank', 'Supernatural' Finales Adjusted Up; revision.text:
The federal Small Business Health Options Program is an insurance exchange, created by [[Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act]] (Obamacare). <ref>http://www.bozemandailychronicle.com/news/health/popular-small-business-health-care-program-may-change-expand/article_dddc4ed4-79bd-11e4-a046-9fa09e151950.html</ref> The Small Business Health Options Program (SHOP) Marketplace helps small businesses to provide health coverage to their employees. Therefore, it is open to employers with 50 or fewer full-time equivalent employees (FTEs), in which it also includes non-profit organizations. <ref>https://www.healthcare.gov/small-businesses/provide-shop-coverage/shop-marketplace-overview/</ref>
According to the [[HealthCare.gov]], the benefit of SHOP Marketplace includes, allowing owner to offer health and dental coverage to employees. Other than that, with flexibility, choice, and the online application and account management, SHOP aims to meets the needs of the business owner and its employees. <ref>https://www.healthcare.gov/small-businesses/provide-shop-coverage/shop-marketplace-overview/</ref>
In 2015 Employee Choice was introduced under of the PPACA's Small Business Health Options Program (SHOP) Marketplace. While SHOP was available for 2014, this is the first year that small employers in 14 states can apply online. Before 2015 employers who provided health insurance to their employees typically worked with an [[insurance broker]] and one [[health insurance company]]. In 2015, they however can offer their employees a choice of insurance companies.
SHOP enrollment is available any time of the year - there is no "Open Enrollment" limitation. Employers who wish to contribute to the premium cost of their employees may qualify to receive a [[SHOP tax credit]].<ref>http://www.biztimes.com/article/20141208/MAGAZINE03/312059981/-1/MAGAZINE</ref> The tax credit is worth up to 50% of employer's contribution toward its employees' premium costs. It will be up to 35% for tax-exempt employers. <ref>https://www.healthcare.gov/small-businesses/provide-shop-coverage/small-business-tax-credits/</ref> Unfortunately, employees can't join the plan after the initial enrollment period unless they are new hires and qualify Special Enrollment Period.<ref>https://www.healthcare.gov/small-businesses/provide-shop-coverage/shop-marketplace-overview/</ref>
According to the [[HealthCare.gov]], special Enrollment Period refers to a time outside of the open enrollment period, in which you and your family have a right to sign up for health coverage. In other words, you qualify for a special enrollment period 60 days following certain life events, including but limited to: change in family status such as marriage or birth of a child, loss of other health coverage.
However, SHOP Marketplace is not offered to self-employed individuals, with no employees. <ref>https://www.healthcare.gov/small-businesses/provide-shop-coverage/shop-marketplace-overview/</ref> They can however get health coverage through [[Health Insurance Marketplace]] for individuals.
As of March 13, 2015, the [[United States Department of Health and Human Services]] claims, evidence has shown that the SHOP marketplace is working in terms of affordability. <ref>https://www.hhs.gov/healthcare/facts/factsheets/2014/10/affordable-care-act-is-working.html</ref> For taxpayers, they are benefiting as the health costs and spending have decreased last year. <ref>content</ref> With a historic slow down in the growth of [[health care prices in the United States|health care costs]], workers, business and taxpayers are able to generate savings under the introduction of SHOP. <ref>https://www.hhs.gov/healthcare/facts/factsheets/2014/10/affordable-care-act-is-working.html</ref>
==References== {{reflist}}
==External links== * https://www.healthcare.gov/small-businesses/employers/ * https://www.healthcare.gov/small-businesses/provide-shop-coverage/
{{PPACA |state=autocollapse}}
[[Category:Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act]] [[Category:Small business|Health Options Program]]

Chairman, [[ARM Holdings]] | known for = | boards = | salary = | networth = | spouse = | parents = | children = | relations = | website = }} '''Stuart John Chambers''' (born May 1956){{cite web|url=https://beta.companieshouse.gov.uk/company/00191285/officers |title=REXAM PLC - Officers (free information from Companies House) |website=Beta.companieshouse.gov.uk |date= |accessdate=2016-04-14}} is a British businessman, the chairman of [[Rexam]] and [[ARM Holdings]]. He will succeed [[John Parker (businessman)|Sir John Parker]] as chairman of [[Anglo American plc]] from 1 November 2017.{{cite news|last1=Yeomans|first1=John|title=Anglo American names Stuart Chambers as chairman|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/business/2017/06/07/anglo-american-names-stuart-chambers-chairman/|accessdate=12 June 2017|work=Telegraph online|date=7 June 2017}} He is a visiting fellow at the [[Saïd Business School]].{{cite web|url=http://www.sbs.ox.ac.uk/community/people/stuart-chambers |title=Stuart Chambers | Saïd Business School |website=Sbs.ox.ac.uk |date= |accessdate=2016-04-14}} ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Chambers, Stuart John}} [[Category:1956 births]] [[Category:British businesspeople]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:ARM people]]

{{Use dmy dates|date=July 2017}} {{Use British English|date=July 2017}}
'''Swissmem''' is the '''Swiss association of mechanical and electrical engineering industries''' (MEM industries). With some 320,000 employees, the MEM industries are Switzerland’s largest industrial employer and,<ref>[http://www.swissmem.ch/en/industry-politics/about-the-industry.html "About the Industry"] Retrieved 2016-02-29.</ref> since they account for 31 percent of the country’s exports, an important economic and political player. In 2015, the nearly 1,000 member companies of Swissmem exported goods worth 63 billion [[Swiss francs]].<ref>[http://www.swissmem.ch/en/industry-politics/about-the-industry.html "About the Industry"] Retrieved 2016-02-29.</ref>
Swissmem was created by the merger of two associations: ASM (Association of Swiss Engineering Employers) und VSM (Swiss Association of Machinery Manufacturers). Both associations have been operating under the Swissmem name since 1999. VSM was renamed Swissmem at the beginning of 2007, when it took over all ASM’s activities with the exception of those associated with the sector’s collective bargaining agreement.<ref>[http://www.swissmem.ch/en/the-association/portrait/historical-background.html "Historical Background"]. Retrieved 2010-12-20.</ref>
Swissmem represents the MEM industries’ interests to the Swiss government, national and international organizations, employee representative bodies and the public. It also acts as the MEM industries’ service centre. In its capacity as employer representative, Swissmem negotiates the terms of the collective bargaining agreement for the MEM industries with the unions. The MEM industries’ collective bargaining agreement is traditionally a benchmark for a large number of collective bargaining agreements in Switzerland, having evolved to its current state of refinement since the "peace agreement" of 1937.<ref>[http://www.sozialpartner.ch/index-e.htm "Agreement in the Mechanical and Electrical Engineering Industry"] Retrieved 2010-12-20.</ref>
== Organization == Swissmem is chaired by Hans Hess since November 2010.<ref>[http://www.swissmem.ch/en/information-policy/media/media-communications/single-view/news/hans-hess-ist-neuer-swissmem-praesident/145.html "Hans Hess becomes new Swissmem President"]. Retrieved 2010-12-20.</ref> Federal Councillor Johann Niklaus Schneider-Ammann was formerly the President of Swissmem.<ref>[http://www.swissmem.ch/en/information-policy/media/media-communications/single-view/news/grosse-freude-ueber-die-wahl-von-johann-n-schneider-ammann/145.html "Delight at the election of Johann N. Schneider-Ammann"] Retrieved 2010-12-20.</ref> In the past, several important officials of Swissmem, ASM or VSM have risen to even more influential positions in the Swiss Employers’ Association (Peter Hasler, Thomas Daum (Switzerland).
Swissmem’s CEO is Peter Dietrich.
== Member companies == Swissmem has nearly 1,000 member companies, including all Switzerland’s major industrial enterprises. Swissmem’s members are divided into the following specialist groups:<ref>[http://www.swissmem.ch/en/organization-members/specialist-groups.html "Specialist Groups"] Retrieved 2014-02-12</ref>
* Assembly and factory [[automation]] * [[Automotive industry|Automotive]] * Compressors, [[Pneumatics|pneumatic]] and vacuum technology * Die and mould industry * Dimensional measurement * [[Environmental technology]] * Graphic machinery * [[Hand tool]]s * Handling and storage equipment * [[Internal combustion engine]]s * [[Machine tool]]s and [[Manufacturing engineering|manufacturing technology]] * [[Packaging engineering|Packaging machinery]] * [[Photonics]] * Plastics machinery * [[Electric power transmission|Power Engineering Transmission]] * [[Precision engineering|Precision tools]] * [[Process engineering]] equipment * [[Pump]] Technology * [[Space industry|Space technology]] * Suppliers SSMI * Swiss [[Additive Manufacturing]] Group * Swiss Airport Suppliers * Swiss ASD * Swiss Fluid Power Industries Group * [[Textile manufacturing|Textile]] machinery * Transmission and distribution * [[Welding]] Technology
== References ==
<references />
== External links == * [http://www.swissmem.ch/en.html Official Website]
{{Authority control}}
[[Category:Business organisations based in Switzerland]] [[Category:Electrical engineering organizations]] [[Category:Mechanical engineering organizations]] [[Category:Science and technology in Switzerland]]

revision.text:
'''Terence Mncedisi Nombembe''' (born 30 September 1961 in [[Qumbu]], [[Eastern Cape]]) is a qualified [[Chartered accountant]] who served as [[Auditor General of South Africa]] from 2006 to 2013.<ref>{{cite news |title=ANC chief whip announces Makwetu as new auditor general |work=[[Mail & Guardian]] |date=11 September 2013 |url=http://mg.co.za/article/2013-09-11-anc-chief-whip-announces-makwetu-as-new-auditor-general}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=AGSA Archives - Personal Info Terence Nombembe |publisher=Auditor-General of South Africa | url=https://www.agsa.co.za/Media/Previouscolumns/tabid/237/Author/5/Default.aspx}}</ref>. During his tenure as Auditor General, Nombembe gained a reputation for integrity. An outspoken critic of corruption, he has been called the commercial equivalent of former Public Protector Advocate [[Thuli Madonsela]].<ref>{{cite news |title=Heroes & Zeroes: A Man of Integrity/|date=29 November 2013 |url=http://www.corruptionwatch.org.za/a-man-of-integrity/ |publisher=Corruption Watch}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title=Terence Nombembe: A Model Civil Servant/|date=8 November 2013 |url=https://mg.co.za/article/2013-11-07-terence-nombembe-a-model-civil-servant/ |publisher=Mail and Guardian}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|author= Alec Hogg |title=Former AG Terence Nombembe: Cleaning up SA one accountant at a time|date=5 December 2014 |url= http://m.fin24.com/fin24/BizNews/Former-AG-Terence-Nombembe-Cleaning-up-SA-one-accountant-at-a-time-20141205|publisher= Fin24}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title= Municipal finance under the spotlight|date=20 August 2013 |url= https://www.infrastructurene.ws/2013/08/20/municipal-finance-under-the-spotlight/|publisher= 3SMedia}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title= SAICA CEO on role of Africa’s youth in financial sector|date=17 October 2016 |url= https://www.cnbcafrica.com/videos/2016/10/17/saica-ceo-on-role-of-africas-youth-in-financial-sector/|publisher= CNBC Africa}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title= Responsible leadership needed, says Terence Nombembe|date= 28 May 2014 |url= http://citizen.co.za/news/south-africa/185886/responsible-leadership-needed-terence-nombembe/|publisher= The Citizen}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|author= Andisiwe Makinana |title= Parliament showers outgoing AG Nombembe with praise|date= 6 November 2013 |url= https://mg.co.za/article/2013-11-06-parliament-showers-outgoing-ag-nombembe-with-praise/|publisher= Mail and Guardian}}</ref>. In August 2017, Nombembe was re-appointed as Non-Executive Director of the [[South African Reserve Bank]]<ref>{{cite news|title=Former Auditor-General reappointed to Reserve Bank board|date=8 August 2017 |url=https://www.enca.com/south-africa/former-auditor-general-reappointed-to-reserve-bank-board|publisher=ENCA News}}</ref>.He is currently the chief executive officer of the [[South African Institute of Chartered Accountants]].<ref>{{cite news |title=KZN Treasury opens its door to aspiring CAs |work=[[South African Broadcasting Corporation]] |date=20 April 2016 |url=http://www.sabc.co.za/news/a/42e96d804c77ec51a294fb3b0fa74342/KZN-Treasury-opens-its-door-to-aspiring-CAs-20162004}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title= Auditor General, Terence Nombembe, appointed new CEO of SAICA|date= 22 November 2013 |url= http://www.businessessentials.co.za/2013/11/22/auditor-general-terence-nombembe-appointed-new-ceo-of-saica/|publisher=Business Essentials}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=An Interview with Terence Nombembe, CEO of the South African Institute of Chartered Accountants|date=3 December 2014 |url=http://www.gaaaccounting.com/an-interview-with-terence-nombembe-ceo-of-the-south-african-institute-of-chartered-accountants/|publisher=GAA Accounting The Journal of the Global Accounting Alliance}}</ref>.
Nombembe matriculated at the Umtata Technical College in 1979. In 1982, Nombembe obtained his Bachelor of Commerce degree from the [[University of Transkei]].In 1986, Nombembe completed his Bachelor of Accounting Science (Honours) degree at the [[University of South Africa]]. Nombembe was conferred with an Honorary Doctorate in Accounting Science from the [[Walter Sisulu University]] in 2014.<ref>{{cite news |title= Walter Sisulu University Acceptance Speech |date= 14 May 2014 |url= http://www.wsu.ac.za/waltersisulu/wp-content/uploads/2014/10/Terence-Speech-at-WSU-May-2014.pdf |publisher= Walter Sisulu University}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title= Honorary Doctorate for former AG |date= 14 May 2014 |url= https://www.pressreader.com/south-africa/the-new-age-free-state/20140514/282840779072839 |publisher= Press Reader The New Age}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |title= Nombembe To Receive Honorary Doctorate From WSU|date= 14 May 2014 |url= http://www.wsu.ac.za/waltersisulu/wp-content/uploads/2013/10/Nombembe-to-receive-honorary-doctorate.docx. |publisher= Walter Sisulu University Media Release}}</ref>
Nombembe is married to Nokwanda and has three children, Mphiwa, Fezekile and Kamvalethu.
==References== {{reflist}}
{{DEFAULTSORT:Nombembe, Terence}} [[Category:1961 births]] [[Category:South African businesspeople]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Walter Sisulu University alumni]]

Saara Kuugongelwa-Amadhila |predecessor1 = [[Helmut Angula]] |successor1 = Obeth Kandjoze |office3 = Governor of the Bank of Namibia |term_start3 = 1 January 1997 |term_end3 = 25 March 2010 |president3 = [[Sam Nujoma]]
[[Hifikepunye Pohamba]]
[[Hage Geingob]] |primeminister3 = [[Hage Geingob]]
[[Theo-Ben Gurirab]]
[[Nahas Angula]] |predecessor3 = |successor3 = [[Ipumbu Shiimi]] }} '''Thomas Kavaningilamo 'Tom' Alweendo''' (born 17 March 1958 in Omusheshe, [[Oshana Region]]) is a [[Namibia]]n businessperson and politician who has been Minister of Mines and Energy since 2018. In 2003, he became the first Namibian [[Governor of the Bank of Namibia]] when he replaced [[Jafaar bin Ahmad]] of [[Malaysia]]. From the mid-1990s until 2001, he was head of [[Air Namibia]]. Alweendo earned a bachelor's degree from the [[University of the Witwatersrand]] in [[South Africa]] and a [[Master of Business Administration]] from the [[University of Wales]] in the [[United Kingdom]].{{Cite web | title= Alweendo, Thomas K. | publisher = [[Parliament of Namibia]] | accessdate=9 March 2018 | url=http://www.parliament.na/index.php?option=com_contact&view=contact&id=964:alweendo-tom-a&catid=104&Itemid=1479}} As Governor of the Bank of Namibia, he maintained the [[Namibian dollar]]'s linkage with the [[South African rand]]. He also raised concerns about increasing amounts of government debt and questioned whether expenditures on education produced better results.[http://www.nid.org.na/view_book_entry.php?book_id=14 Tom Alweendo] Namibia Institute for Democracy {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110611171207/http://www.nid.org.na/view_book_entry.php?book_id=14 |date=June 11, 2011 }} In 2010 Alweendo was appointed to lead the National Planning Commission. When [[Hage Geingob]] took office as President in March 2015, he confirmed him in this post, now named Minister in the Presidency in charge of the National Planning Commission.{{cite news | title=Costly Democracy | last1=Immanuel | first1=Shinovene | last2=Mongudhi | first2=Tileni | newspaper=[[The Namibian]] | date=20 March 2015 | pages=1–2 | url=http://www.namibian.com.na/indexx.php?id=24690}} In a Cabinet reshuffle in February 2018, Alweendo became Minister of Mines and Energy, swapping positions with [[Obeth Kandjoze]].{{Cite news | title=President reshuffles Cabinet—Vice President relieved of duties | last=Matthys | first=Donald | newspaper=[[Namibia Economist]] | date=8 February 2018 | url=https://economist.com.na/32603/general-news/president-reshuffles-cabinet-vice-president-relieved-of-duties/}} ==References== {{reflist}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Alweendo, Tom}} [[Category:1958 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Namibian businesspeople]] [[Category:Alumni of the University of Wales]] [[Category:University of the Witwatersrand alumni]] [[Category:Namibian expatriates in the United Kingdom]] [[Category:Namibian expatriates in South Africa]] {{Namibia-politician-stub}} {{Africa-business-bio-stub}}

revision.comment: BOT--Reverting link addition(s) by [[:en:Special:Contributions/213.127.209.164|213.127.209.164]] to revision 657384040 (https://gpsbattery.wordpress.com/ [\bwordpress\.com])
revision.text:
{{One source|date=March 2009}}
'''Trailer tracking''' is tracking the position of an [[Semi-trailer truck|articulated vehicle]]’s [[Semi-trailer|trailer]] unit through a tracking device fitted to the trailer.<ref Name="Donath">{{cite book |title= The IOMA Handbook of Logistics and Inventory Management |last= Donath |first= Bob |authorlink= |year= 2002 |publisher= John Wiley and Sons |location= |isbn= 978-0-471-20935-5 |page= 320 |pages= |url= }}</ref> A [[communication network]] or [[satellite]] network is then used to transfer this positional data to a centralised collection point. Trailer tracking is used to increase [[productivity]] by optimising the use of trailer fleets.
==Trailer Tracking System== Trailer tracking systems can provide essential information to trailer operators on; status, location, door activity and history. These systems utilize the information to provide reliable and protected services to shippers of perishable commodities.
Trailer Tracking is also a trucking term in which, when a Semi turns a corner the trailer tires will be closer to the curb (even jump the curb if semi turns to sharp) than the truck cab will be.
Trailer tracking systems require 4 essential components to operate.
# Tracking Device # Communication Network # Back-end Server and Database # User Interface Software
==See also== * [[GPS tracking server]] * [[GPS tracking unit]]
==References== {{reflist}}
[[Category:Logistics]]

{{chinese name|[[Xú|Tsui]]}} {{Infobox Chinese-language singer and actor | name = Tsui Siu-ming | image = | caption = | chinesename = 徐小明 | tradchinesename = | simpchinesename = | pinyinchinesename = Xú2 Xiǎo3 Míng2 | jyutpingchinesename = Ceoi4 Siu2 Ming4 | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1953|11|28|df=y}} | birth_place = Hong Kong | death_date = | death_place = | restingplace = | restingplacecoordinates = | othername = Xu Xiaoming
Siuming Tsui | occupation = [[screenwriter]], [[film producer]], [[actor]], [[assistant director]], [[production management|production manager]], and [[stage combat|action choreographer]] | genre =}} '''Tsui Siu-ming''' ({{zh|c=徐小明}}; born 1953) is a [[Hong Kong]]-based [[actor]], [[screenwriter]], [[film producer]], [[assistant director]], [[production management|production manager]], and [[stage combat|action choreographer]]. ==Career== A native of [[Guangdong]], Tsui was once a recognized [[Child singer|child star]]. He had tried his hands in singing during the 1970s and 1980s with such tunes as "The New Chameleon", "Za Xiang Hu Shan Xing" and "Huei Sheng Gu Li Nian Li Qing".[http://hkmdb.com/db/people/bio.mhtml?id=3187&display_set=eng HKMDB] He also produced drama [[Serial (radio and television)|serials]] for [[Rediffusion Television]] ([[Rediffusion Television|RTV]]) such as the rating-topper "Chameleon". Tsui worked for ATV in 1998 and became CEO of [[Emperor Entertainment Group|Emperor Motion Pictures]] in the subsequent year where he was responsible for film and TV business development. {{citation needed|date=June 2009}} In March 2005, he founded [[Sundream Motion Pictures]], a [[subsidiary]] of [[pay TV]] provider [[I-CABLE Communications|I-CABLE Communications Ltd.]], producing films such as ''[[Twins Mission]]'' and ''[[Eye in the Sky (2007 film)|Eye in the Sky]]''. {{citation needed|date=June 2009}} ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *{{IMDb name|0875291}} *[http://hkmdb.com/db/people/bio.mhtml?id=3187&display_set=eng Tsui Siu-ming biography at the Hong Kong Movie Database] * [http://www.hkcinemagic.com/en/people.asp?id=151 HK cinemagic entry] {{authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Tsui, Siuming}} [[Category:1953 births]] [[Category:Hong Kong male child actors]] [[Category:Hong Kong businesspeople]] [[Category:Hong Kong film producers]] [[Category:Hong Kong screenwriters]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Asian film producers]] [[Category:Members of the Election Committee of Hong Kong, 2007–2012]] [[Category:Members of the Election Committee of Hong Kong, 2012–2017]]
